intro: Rhytidophyllum rhodocalyx, commonly known as the red-veined hakea, is a unique plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, leathery foliage. The plant features striking red veins on its leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Rhytidophyllum rhodocalyx is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions.
